channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-15727] Canary Tool for Zookeeper
item.description:
It would be nice to have the canary tool also monitor zookeeper. Something simple like doing a getData() call on zookeeper.znode.parent

It would be nice to create clients for every instance in the quorum such that you could monitor overloaded or poor behaving instances.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: I just time getData() for the base znode? Even though an exists() call is made. I was torn whether to time both, but thought getData() would be a better measure.

-1 overall

44	import com.google.common.base.Stopwatch;

Can you avoid dependence on Google's Stopwatch ? See HBASE-14963


107	 * outputs some information about failure of latency.

of -> or

oh yeah, my bad. I'll get rid of it and use the commons one. Always forget which one is StopWatch and Stopwatch.

Any other comments, concerns before I put up a new patch?

Good catch Ted.

Can you share experience using this new mode on a cluster ?

Thanks
Patch without google stopwatch dependency. Ted Yu we applied this patch to our light fork and will start using it soon, I will provide you with an update in the near future.

TestCanaryTool.java has been added to repo by HBASE-15617

Mind rebasing the patch ?
rebased
Looks good. Does this work with different zk client ports? We are parsing the quorum string, but in HBase unfortunately, quorum string does not contain the port usually.

Enis Soztutar were you thinking about something more along the lines of this: 

 new ConnectStringParser(ZkConfig.getZKQuorumServersStringFromHbaseConfig(conf))
Indeed. Otherwise, if client port is not 2181, this will not work.
